content.raw:
I am reopening this as bug because … the accelerometer value depends on the controller speed. I reduced logging of communication to ROS and large images in order to be sure that within 1hour the OSGAR log file is not too big and the local simulation docker now triggers collisions at the tunnel entrance as X2 tries to stop. :disappointed: 

Was there any change related to machine speed and accelerometer simulation?! \(somehow it reminds me issues with IMU?? In release notes I see 13th Sept “Updated the collision of the ramp tunnel.” is it related??

`osrf/subt-virtual-testbed                                    cloudsim_bridge_latest        d8c6a32fef70        2 weeks ago         3.41GB`

Or are there ramp-up/ramp-down necessary for speed control of X2 robot?
content.html:
I am reopening this as bug because … the accelerometer value depends on the controller speed. I reduced logging of communication to ROS and large images in order to be sure that within 1hour the OSGAR log file is not too big and the local simulation docker now triggers collisions at the tunnel entrance as X2 tries to stop.

Was there any change related to machine speed and accelerometer simulation?! (somehow it reminds me issues with IMU?? In release notes I see 13th Sept “Updated the collision of the ramp tunnel.” is it related??

osrf/subt-virtual-testbed cloudsim_bridge_latest d8c6a32fef70 2 weeks ago 3.41GB

Or are there ramp-up/ramp-down necessary for speed control of X2 robot?
